results.title: Communication satellites
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems of World Order”.
Explores the world implications of sophisticated ommunication facilities, particularly with respect to technologically advanced and underdeveloped countries. Focuses on control problems of potential power of the Intersat and the Comsat. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Communicating with kinder kids
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: A video “test” for interested groups e.g. health care workers, audiologists, speech therapists, kindergarten teachers and parents, so that they can recognise language and speech disorders in kindergarten age children.

results.title: Communicating with a group
results.creator_credit: John Krish and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager in Action”.
This film takes the form of a dramatised in-company training session on group communication. The film is designed to improve the abilities of people to communicate effectively with all groups. The special problems of communication with groups are identified.

results.title: Communicating in a team
results.brief_description: This video is a guide as to how to communicate better in a team environment. The first recommended step is to accept the diversity of the modern workplace and the array of backgrounds of staff members. This means having patience and understanding that those from another cultural background may find it harder to absorb instructions. Tolerance is the key to successful team environments. The second recommended step is to participate in meetings, listen to each other and show interest, stay on track, and do not divert from the meeting’s main topic; be open to ideas, don’t jump in early and trounce others’ ideas. Lastly, ask your manager for feedback. Be specific and probe for precise ways in which to improve your performance.

results.title: Communicate to live
results.creator_credit: Ronnie Whitehouse, Sam Napier-Bell, Basic Films and Post Office Telecommunications
results.brief_description: Shows how communication is essential to a wide range of animal life, and gives a history of human communication and the possibilities for electronic communication in the future.

results.title: Commonwealth prime ministers in Britain
results.creator_credit: Geof Sherley and British Movietone News
results.brief_description: The visit to Britain in 1960 of the Commonwealth Prime Ministers. Includes the then Prime Minister of Australia, Sir Robert Menzies and his wife Dame Patti.

results.title: Commonwealth of Nations
results.brief_description: The nature, extent and constitution of the British Commonwealth - its purpose, benefits derived from it and the relationship among its members. The historical background is presented, beginning 200 years ago when British colonies were scattered in newly discovered lands all over the world. The seed of the Commonwealth was germinated when Canada was granted her independence. Contains historical footage of 1950s Sydney.

results.title: Commonwealth Journey [Edited Version]
results.brief_description: A record of the 1959 Commonwealth Tour of the Duke of Edinburgh, compiled film coverage of India, Pakistan, Brunei, North Borneo, Hong Kong, the British Solomon Islands, the Gilbert and Ellice Islands, Christmas Island, the Bahamas and Bermuda.
